caption:
This photograph captures a winter scene at a beach setting. In the foreground, several picnic tables, which consist of circular benches integrated with round tabletops, are scattered across the snowy ground. Each table appears to be made of metal and is overturned or tilted, suggesting they have been moved from their usual positions, possibly by strong winds or simply set aside for the winter season.

The snow on the ground is patchy, with areas of brown earth peeking through, indicating either light snowfall or partial melting of the snow. Footprints and traces in the snow suggest recent activity in the area.

In the background, the choppy grey waters of a large body of water, likely a lake or sea, stretch towards the horizon. The sky is overcast with heavy, moody clouds suggesting an imminent or recent snowstorm. There are no visible buildings or human figures in the scene, which, along with the dull weather and abandoned tables, imparts a sense of isolation and abandonment typically not associated with beach settings. A single bird can be faintly seen in the sky, contributing to the desolate, wintery atmosphere. The overall composition and muted color palette convey a poignant, almost melancholic mood reflective of the off-season at a place usually associated with recreation and gatherings.
title: Officers' beach at fort Sheridan on lake Michigan.  Storm tossed waters threaten to engulf the picnic tables
